```{R}
# Set seed for reproducibility
set.seed(123)

# Number of observations
n <- 100

# Feature 1 (High Correlation) - Linear
x1 <- seq(from = 0, to = 10, length.out = n)

# Feature 2 (Highly Correlated with x1) - Also Linear
x2 <- x1 * 2 + rnorm(n, mean = 0, sd = 1)  # Add some noise

# Other Features - Polynomial Relationship
x3 <- x1^2 + rnorm(n, mean = 0, sd = 0.5)
x4 <- x1^3 + rnorm(n, mean = 0, sd = 0.7)

# Create the data frame
synthetic_data <- data.frame(
  x1 = x1,
  x2 = x2,
  x3 = x3,
  x4 = x4
)


# Display first few rows to check
head(synthetic_data)




```



```{r}
library(ggplot2)

ggplot(synthetic_data, aes(x = x2, y = x4)) + 
    geom_point(color='steelblue', size=2) +
    geom_smooth(
      method = lm,
      formula = y ~ poly(x, degree= 2),
      se = TRUE,
      color = 'darkred'
    ) +
    labs(
      
      title = "Linear Regression",
      
      x = "The X1 variable",
      y = "The x2 variable"
      
    ) +
    
    theme_minimal()
       




```

```{R}
# Automatic vs manual accerelation

ggplot(mtcars, aes(x = factor(am), y = qsec)) +
  geom_boxplot(width = 0.1, fill = "steelblue", color="green") +
  geom_jitter(width = 0.1) +
  stat_summary(fun = mean, geom = "point", shape = 24, fill = "red") +
  labs(
    title = "Analysis of auto cars accerelation vs manual cars",
    x = "Manual transmission mode 0 for auto",
    y = "distribution of accelerations"
  )






```





```{R}
aof_summary <- aov(qsec ~ am, data = mtcars)

summary(aof_summary)



```

```{md}
**We fail to reject H0: No statistical significance on group mean P() > 0.05**
```
